comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: A mystery monument in the backgound. Help us identify it.

comment.author: 77541634@N00
comment._content: My initial thought is the monument looks very much like the King George V monument in front of Parliament House in Canberra. The hill behind could be looking back towards Mt Ainslie when the monument was still in its old location directly in front of Parliament House. The monument in Canberra doesn't appear to have the statue on top of it. I'll keep looking for another photo. Are you sure it was taken in Brisbane? nla.gov.au/nla.pic-an24896072 maps.google.com/maps?q=canberra&hl=en&ll=-35.3013...

comment.author: 77541634@N00
comment._content: Actually - it might be the King George V monument in Albert Street. It's a bit tiny in these photos by Frank Hurley nla.gov.au/nla.pic-an23478002 nla.gov.au/nla.pic-an23208124

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/paulhagon] NOt sure if it was taken in Queensland - It's in our collection because Sir Walter Cooper was, I think the Governor of Queensland and there are a number of photos of him and/or his wife in Brisbane during the tour.

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: This picture is a puzzle waiting to be solved. The monument that was in Albert Street has a horse on the top and this one does not. Leaning towards the King George V monument in Canberra but not wholly convinced.

comment.author: 77541634@N00
comment._content: In this photo from the National Archives, the Queen appears to be wearing the same outfit, shoes & handbag. recordsearch.naa.gov.au/scripts/PhotoSearchItemDetail.asp... This photo from the National Archives shows the area & looks as though it was taken from on top of the statue. Maybe that's a tripod & legs on top. It is raining in this image though, rather than bright sunshine. recordsearch.naa.gov.au/scripts/PhotoSearchItemDetail.asp...

comment.author: 76116152@N06
comment._content: Sir Walter Cooper was a Senator for Queensland and a Minister in the Menzies Govt. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walter_Cooper_(politician) He was probably the most senior federal Minister from Queensland, which is why there are lots of photos of he & Lady Cooper. I would say this photo was taken in Canberra.
